page.title: 11WOODLAND AROUND MORDIFORD
page.content: Haugh Woods cover 400 hectares.It contains 15 different varieties of tree including many hardwoods and plantings of spruce evergreens.About 4 hectares of replanting is done a year. The main function of the wood is the production of timber but great care is taken environmentally. Haugh Woods is run in close cooperation with the Nature Conservancy Council and other bodies interested in nature and conservation. It is regarded as one of the best 3 woods in England for wildlife (particularly its butterflies - having the widest variety in the country). The forest is owned by Major Davenport and Major Hereford. The head forester, Mr John Anderson is in charge of environmental management in the wood. There are 5 or 6 other people employed in direct connection with the woods.
